segment.source: Audit account logon events (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit account logon events (Windows 10)

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another device in which this device is used to validate the account.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another device in which this device is used to validate the account.

segment.source: Audit account logon events
segment.target: Audit account logon events

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another device in which this device is used to validate the account.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another device in which this device is used to validate the account.

segment.source: This security setting determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another computer in which this computer is used to validate the account.
segment.target: This security setting determines whether to audit each instance of a user logging on to or logging off from another computer in which this computer is used to validate the account.

segment.source: Account logon events are generated when a domain user account is authenticated on a domain controller.
segment.target: Account logon events are generated when a domain user account is authenticated on a domain controller.

segment.source: The event is logged in the domain controller's security log.
segment.target: The event is logged in the domain controller's security log.

segment.source: Logon events are generated when a local user is authenticated on a local computer.
segment.target: Logon events are generated when a local user is authenticated on a local computer.

segment.source: The event is logged in the local security log.
segment.target: The event is logged in the local security log.

segment.source: Account logoff events are not generated.
segment.target: Account logoff events are not generated.

segment.source: If you define this policy setting, you can specify whether to audit successes, audit failures, or not audit the event type at all.
segment.target: If you define this policy setting, you can specify whether to audit successes, audit failures, or not audit the event type at all.

segment.source: Success audits generate an audit entry when an account logon attempt succeeds.
segment.target: Success audits generate an audit entry when an account logon attempt succeeds.

segment.source: Failure audits generate an audit entry when an account logon attempt fails.
segment.target: Failure audits generate an audit entry when an account logon attempt fails.

segment.source: To set this value to No auditing, in the Properties dialog box for this policy setting, select the Define these policy settings check box and clear the Success and Failure check boxes.
segment.target: To set this value to No auditing, in the Properties dialog box for this policy setting, select the Define these policy settings check box and clear the Success and Failure check boxes.

segment.source: Default: Success
segment.target: Default: Success

segment.source: Configure this audit setting
segment.target: Configure this audit setting

segment.source: You can configure this security setting by opening the appropriate policy under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.
segment.target: You can configure this security setting by opening the appropriate policy under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.

segment.source: Logon events
segment.target: Logon events

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: An authentication service (AS) ticket was successfully issued and validated.
segment.target: An authentication service (AS) ticket was successfully issued and validated.

segment.source: A ticket granting service (TGS) ticket was granted.
segment.target: A ticket granting service (TGS) ticket was granted.

segment.source: A security principal renewed an AS ticket or TGS ticket.
segment.target: A security principal renewed an AS ticket or TGS ticket.

segment.source: Preauthentication failed.
segment.target: Preauthentication failed.

segment.source: This event is generated on a Key Distribution Center (KDC) when a user types in an incorrect password.
segment.target: This event is generated on a Key Distribution Center (KDC) when a user types in an incorrect password.

segment.source: Authentication ticket request failed.
segment.target: Authentication ticket request failed.

segment.source: This event is not generated in Windows XP or in the Windows Server 2003 family.
segment.target: This event is not generated in Windows XP or in the Windows Server 2003 family.

segment.source: A TGS ticket was not granted.
segment.target: A TGS ticket was not granted.

segment.source: This event is not generated in Windows XP or in the Windows Server 2003 family.
segment.target: This event is not generated in Windows XP or in the Windows Server 2003 family.

segment.source: An account was successfully mapped to a domain account.
segment.target: An account was successfully mapped to a domain account.

segment.source: Logon failure.
segment.target: Logon failure.

segment.source: A domain account logon was attempted.
segment.target: A domain account logon was attempted.

segment.source: This event is not generated in Windows XP or in the Windows Server 2003 family.
segment.target: This event is not generated in Windows XP or in the Windows Server 2003 family.

segment.source: A user has reconnected to a disconnected terminal server session.
segment.target: A user has reconnected to a disconnected terminal server session.

segment.source: A user disconnected a terminal server session without logging off.
segment.target: A user disconnected a terminal server session without logging off.
